intro: Exogonium arenarium, commonly known as the sand exogonium, is a rare and unusual plant species characterized by its unique botanical features. It is a member of the Exogonaceae family and is distinguished by its specialized growth structure, which includes a central stem surrounded by a dense layer of parenchyma cells. The plant thrives in arid environments, adapting to extreme conditions through its thick, waxy cuticle that minimizes water loss.
